sections.title: Special Materials Overview
sections.description: Overview of special materials, their general properties, and how they affect weapons and armor crafting

sections.title: Abysium
sections.description: Glowing blue-green skymetal that causes sickness but provides light and can be made into poison

sections.title: Adamantine
sections.description: Extremely strong metal that bypasses hardness when sundering and grants damage reduction to armor

sections.title: Angelskin
sections.description: Preserved angel skin that masks evil auras and provides protection against evil-detecting abilities

sections.title: Aszite
sections.description: Navy-blue Shadow Plane ore that enhances darkness spells and provides stealth bonuses

sections.title: Magic Bridge Basalt
sections.description: Magically preserved basalt from ancient bridges that enhances construct creation

sections.title: Bone
sections.description: Animal-based material including horn, shell, and ivory that creates fragile but affordable weapons and armor

sections.title: Bronze
sections.description: Ancient metal that can replace steel but has fragile quality, including brass and copper variants

sections.title: Cryptstone
sections.description: Dense gray stone from mausoleums that provides bonuses against undead creatures

sections.title: Blood Crystal
sections.description: Bloodcraving crystal that deals extra damage to bleeding targets and changes color when feeding

sections.title: Darkleaf Cloth
sections.description: Flexible material from darkwood trees that reduces spell failure and improves armor mobility

sections.title: Darkwood
sections.description: Rare magic wood that is hard as normal wood but very light, improving shields and wooden weapons

sections.title: Druchite
sections.description: Black-violet Shadow Plane ore that provides miss chance against darkvision and attack bonuses

sections.title: Djezet
sections.description: Liquid skymetal that enhances spellcasting by increasing effective spell levels

sections.title: Dragonhide
sections.description: Dragon skin armor that provides energy immunity and can be enhanced with Dragoncrafting feat

sections.title: Dragonskin
sections.description: Dragon underbelly skin used for weapon grips that provides bonus against disarm attempts

sections.title: Eel Hide
sections.description: Supple hide that provides electricity resistance and improves armor flexibility

sections.title: Elysian Bronze
sections.description: Titan-crafted bronze that provides bonuses against magical beasts and monstrous humanoids

sections.title: Gold
sections.description: Ceremonial metal that is fragile, heavy, and expensive but used for gold-plated items

sections.title: Greenwood
sections.description: Living wood harvested from treant-animated trees that heals itself when watered and soiled

sections.title: Griffon Mane
sections.description: Cloth woven from magical beast manes that provides fly bonuses and reduces flight magic costs

sections.title: Horacalcum
sections.description: Rarest skymetal that warps time and provides initiative bonuses and attack bonuses

sections.title: Inubrix
sections.description: Soft skymetal that phases through iron and steel armor but is always treated as broken

sections.title: Cold Iron
sections.description: Iron forged at low temperature that is effective against demons and fey creatures

sections.title: Mindglass
sections.description: Psychic-resistant material that stores mental energy and creates disruptive fields on hits

sections.title: Mithral
sections.description: Rare silvery metal that is lighter than steel, reduces armor category, and counts as silver

sections.title: Noqual
sections.description: Pale green crystal-like metal that resists magic and provides bonuses against constructs and undead

sections.title: Obsidian
sections.description: Sharp volcanic glass used for piercing and slashing weapons but unsuitable for armor

sections.title: Siccatite
sections.description: Temperature-extreme silver metal that deals fire or cold damage and provides energy resistance

sections.title: Alchemical Silver
sections.description: Silver bonded to steel weapons to bypass lycanthrope damage reduction with damage penalty

sections.title: Silversheen
sections.description: Special metal that counts as alchemical silver and is immune to rust effects

sections.title: Skymetal Alloys
sections.description: Alloys mixing skymetals with other materials, particularly glaucite made from adamantine and iron

sections.title: Fire-forged Steel
sections.description: Dwarven steel that channels heat away from wearer and absorbs fire damage for weapon bonuses

sections.title: Frost-forged Steel
sections.description: Steel that channels heat toward wearer and provides cold damage effects similar to fire-forged steel

sections.title: Living Steel
sections.description: Self-repairing metal that damages attacking weapons and slowly heals itself over time

sections.title: Singing Steel
sections.description: Gold-mithral alloy that emits bell tones and enhances bardic performances

sections.title: Stainless Steel
sections.description: Chromium-plated steel that is immune to rusting effects and splendidly shiny

sections.title: Stone
sections.description: Stone Age material for primitive weapons including rock-hafted maces and flint knives

sections.title: Sunsilk
sections.description: Golden silk that provides damage reduction against non-bludgeoning attacks

sections.title: Sunsilver
sections.description: Silver that counts as alchemical silver, resists rust, and can dazzle enemies in bright light

sections.title: SerpentStone
sections.description: Ancient serpentfolk stone that can be programmed to emit light, sound, temperature, and illusions

sections.title: Spiresteel
sections.description: Quintessence-based metal that protects against incorporeal attacks and can stagger on critical hits

sections.title: Viridium
sections.description: Toxic green volcanic glass that causes leprosy and greenblood oil effects

sections.title: Voidglass
sections.description: Grioth crystal material that provides mental defenses and psychic damage bonuses

sections.title: Whipwood
sections.description: Flexible vanara composite wood that resists sundering and gains extra hit points

sections.title: Wyroot
sections.description: Wyrwood tree root that absorbs life force on critical hits and converts it to ki or arcane pool points
